image.altText: Sally Catherall standing in her front yard.

props.synopsis: The ABC speaks to those who took alternative and complementary medicines after a cancer diagnosis and how they navigated their beliefs.

title.children: Cancer patient told she wasn't 'positive enough' when turmeric didn't work

image.altText: Police officers stand on a street verge behind blue and white crime scene tape

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man has been released under a community supervision order after being found not guilty, due to insanity, of attempting to murder his housemate.

title.children: Man who believed podcast told him to stab housemate released under community supervision

image.altText: Three children: JayBird Byrne, Lani and Luca.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian kids experience 'school can't'. For these families, finding a system that works has transformed their child's life.

title.children: 'Unschooling' kids are thriving after leaving the classroom

image.altText: Small orange fish next to a ruler that indicates they are only a couple of millimeters long.

props.synopsis: They may look a little like popcorn, but these baby red handfish are giving hope for the species' survival.Â

title.children: Hatchlings' arrival gives hope for critically endangered fish species

image.altText: Man using an adapted mountain bike, second man on a mountain bike behind him on a track.

props.synopsis: When Gordon Broome took up adapted mountain biking during his rehabilitation, it set him on a path to help others do the same.Â

title.children: Adapted mountain biking makes wilderness accessible for paraplegic riders

image.altText: Cheryl Willie with husband Terry and their Christmas-themed tractor display.

props.synopsis: Santa's sleigh being pulled by dirt bikes. Santa on a tractor. Santa sitting on a dunny, with an elf alongside. The roadside Christmas displays in this very out-of-the-way town are worth the trip.

title.children: Tiny Tassie town puts itself 'on the map' with festive displays

image.altText: Rob McEwan looks over with plans for construction laid out on a desk in an office.

props.synopsis: After workers dug up two skeletons at a Hobart school's hockey field it was believed there'd likely be more. But the scale of what the archaeological team found was staggering.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Nearly 2,000 bodies found under school's sporting field, in what is believed to be Australia's biggest exhumation

image.altText: Woman vlogging at home with Christmas tree behind.

props.synopsis: A relatively new type of advertising is seeing "explosive growth" due to converging trends in consumer behaviour, with industry experts saying this Christmas will be the biggest ever for affiliate marketers.

title.children: Hidden commissions behind this year's Christmas gift guide boom

image.altText: Headshots of the two men side by side.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Farik bin Amin and Mohammed Nazir bin Lep, who had been in custody since 2003, have been returned to their home country of Malaysia, US authorities say.

title.children: Bali bombing duo released from Guantanamo Bay

image.altText: The bar at Warwick Resort Fiji where the guests who became ill were served.

props.synopsis: A toxicology report into the suspected alcohol poisonings at Fiji's Warwick Resort that left four Australians critically ill has found no traces of methanol.

title.children: 'No methanol' found in Fiji alcohol poisoning that hospitalised Australians

image.altText: A silver four-wheel-drive vehicle with its front end squashed under a collapsed building roof with debris scattered around

props.synopsis: Vanuatu's tourism businesses say visitors will play a major role in its post-earthquake recovery, when the country is ready for them.

title.children: Vanuatu tourism operators hope Australians will help post-quake recovery

image.altText: John Marsden stands in front of a bookshelf as he smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Marsden, a world-renowned author of children's and young adult fiction, wrote the beloved adventure novel Tomorrow, When the War Began.

title.children: Tomorrow, When the War Began author John Marsden dies aged 74

image.altText: Damien Richardson speaking

props.synopsis: A former actor known for his roles on Blue Heelers, Neighbours and McLeods Daughters has been charged by Victoria Police for performing a Nazi salute.

title.children: Victoria Police charge former Neighbours star over performing Nazi salute

image.altText: Travis Head plays a pull shot while three Indian fielders watch on

props.synopsis: Australia and India have to settle for an inevitable draw at the Gabba, but not before a wild session of play on day five raised a few more untimely questions for the Aussie batters.

title.children: Australia counts the gifts and the gaffes from a very silly Gabba Test

image.altText: Penny Wong during a media conference.

props.synopsis: Israeli media is reporting the country's Foreign Minister, Gideon Sa'ar, blasted Penny Wong during a phone call on Tuesday, accusing Australia of abandoning Israel in its most difficult year.

title.children: Penny Wong plays down 'heated' call with Israeli counterpart

image.altText: Transmission towers and lines passing through the Latrobe Valley

props.synopsis: A major transmission project that will connect Snowy Hydro 2.0 to the energy grid has received final government approval, taking the total cost of the pumped hydro scheme to almost $17 billion.

title.children: Government approves transmission project linking Snowy Hydro 2.0 to grid

image.altText: A flooded regional road.

props.synopsis: Heavy rain has led Queensland authorities to issue an emergency alert for South Burnett, where some roads have been cut by flash flooding.

title.children: Emergency alert issued after flooding in Queensland

image.altText: Igor Kirillov speaks during a briefing, wearing green military uniform adorned with medals.

props.synopsis: Russia has detained a citizen of Uzbekistan who it says has confessed to planting the bomb that killed Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov in Moscow.

title.children: Russia says it has detained suspect over killing of top general Igor Kirillov

image.altText: Two woman and a man holding a tablet look at another man

props.synopsis: Laid was the uniquely Aussie story of a woman whose exes start mysteriously dying. Now the Americans have got their hands on it.

title.children: Laid proves that Americans should leave Aussie sitcoms alone

image.altText: A man in a collared shirt looks forward.

props.synopsis: ACT senator David Pocock said it happened but now a former Services Australia employee says his toilet breaks were monitored.Â

title.children: 'Dehumanising': Former Services Australia employee claims toilet breaks were timed

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu and five other men wearing black clothing with green vests standing on a hillside

props.synopsis: Israel seized a swath of southern Syria along the border with the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights days after Bashar al-Assad was ousted by rebels last week. The Israeli PM says the troops will stay until another arrangement is in place "that ensures Israel's security".

title.children: Israeli PM says troops to occupy Syria buffer zone for foreseeable future

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue spacesuits pose for a photo, smiling.

props.synopsis: The delay means what should have been an eight-day stay on the International Space Station for Suni Williams and Butch Wilmore will now be at least nine months.

title.children: Return of NASA astronauts from ISS further delayed until late March

image.altText: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol delivers a speech from behind an official lectern.

props.synopsis: President Yoon Suk Yeol, who was impeached on Saturday, was summoned for questioning over his bid to implement martial law earlier this month.

title.children: Impeached South Korean president fails to appear at corruption hearing

image.altText: A bird covered in oil along a beach, surrounded by oil slicks.

props.synopsis: Thousands of volunteers are working to clean up oil slicks along sandy beaches in Russia after two stricken tankers spilled oil into the Black Sea.

title.children: Russian authorities declare state of emergency over Black Sea oil spill

image.altText: Two men in colourful suits look serious as they speak to each other in a hallway.

props.synopsis: A British court has ruled that police can seize more than $4 million to cover years of unpaid taxes from "manosphere" influencer Andrew Tate and his brother Tristan.

title.children: UK police to seize more than $4m in unpaid taxes from Andrew Tate

image.altText: A person wearing a hard hat on a stretcher is surrounded by rescue workers in caving gear in a brown cave tunnel

props.synopsis: Ottavia Piana has been rescued after falling several metres while exploring deep within an uncharted part of a cave north-east of Bergamo, in northern Italy.

title.children: Italian woman rescued from cave for second time in two years

image.altText: aerial shots of Paradise Dam

props.synopsis: It has been revealed the 300,000 megalitre dam south-west of Bundaberg will cost at least $4.4 billion to rebuild. However, the dam operator says the cost could go even higher.

title.children: Queensland's failed Paradise Dam will cost at least $4.4b to rebuild

image.altText: A hand in a white rubber glove holding a black ball.

props.synopsis: Balls of chemicals and waste were first found at Coogee in October, then at Kiama in November. Now the debris is turning up even further south, causing beach closures during the far south coast's peak tourism period.

title.children: Mystery balls wash up on beaches 300km from Sydney, threatening tourism

image.altText: A man with light brown hair wearing a blue shirt

props.synopsis: A "predatory" photographer who committed child sex offences has been slammed by his victims in court and labelled a "monster" who ruined their lives. Warning: This story contains details readers may find confronting.

title.children: Adelaide photographer who sexually abused kids labelled 'monster' in court

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: Australia's peak legal body and prominent defence lawyers have questioned laws stopping a High Court challenge to evidence gathered in one of Australia's biggest organised crime busts, saying they establish a dangerous precedent.

title.children: New law stops High Court challenge to legality of encrypted message gathering

image.altText: An old man in a suit walks with his male lawyer amongst a media scrum.

props.synopsis: The 83-year-old has denied all alleged historical offences of indecent assault and sexual touching.

title.children: 'Baseless or they distort the truth': Alan Jones breaks silence on charges

image.altText: image of convicted terrorist Abdul Benbrika

props.synopsis: Convicted terrorist Abdul Nacer Benbrika, who served close to 20 years for plotting terror attacks in Melbourne, will remain under government supervision for at least another month.

title.children: Convicted terrorist Abdul Nacer Benbrika to be supervised over Christmas

image.altText: An aerial view of the Kalgoorlie racecourse with green turf and mining headframe in the foreground.

props.synopsis: One of Western Australia's biggest provincial racing clubs is on the brink of disaster, with its 2025 season likely to be abandoned due to a lack of recycled water for its turf track.

title.children: Kalgoorlie racing season faces the axe due to looming water shortage

image.altText: New site announcement

props.synopsis: NSW Police allege the triple j Unearthed website was used to organise a stabbing attack on an inmate inside the Goulburn Correctional Centre earlier this year.

title.children: Inmates allegedly exploit loophole on ABC music website to plan stabbing

image.altText: A red tram travels down a road in Parramatta.

props.synopsis: Doors will open on the new L4 Westmead and Carlingford Line from Friday morning, with the service to take passengers through the heart of Parramatta's CBD.

title.children: 'Years in the making': Parramatta light rail to open on Friday
